item.title: Report E-2025010400
item.description:
Report E-2025010400

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4998
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0745 ET, Danny Mabry with Circle K store # 4703699 notified ERTS of a premium gasoline release located in Murfreesboro, TN. It was reported that approximately 30 gallons released from Fuel South Express due to overfill. The release impacted concrete only. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. At 0920 on 1/9/25 HEPACO arrived onsite to the gasoline release. The gasoline that spilled impacted a 60' x 5' area on the asphalt parking lot. Oil dry is already placed down on the spill. The 30 gallon spill estimate is accurate. HEPACO worked on sweeping up the oil dry and will apply more after. HEPACO generated 2 55-gallon metal drums of gasoline impacted absorbents

item.title: Report X-2025011193
item.description:
Report X-2025011193

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained six metal can all in a plastic bag with packing paper for dunnage. The screw cap on one of the cans was loose causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025011192
item.description:
Report X-2025011192

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. Inside was three metal cans packaged in a plastic bag with fiberboard dividers and packing peanuts for dunnage. One of the can was dented on the top causing the screw cap to loosen and spill the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025011109
item.description:
Report X-2025011109

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the MEMH location during sort operations. Inside of the fiberboard box was four metal cans with positive closure rings in plastic bags with fiberboard dividers. One of the cans was damaged on the bottom chime causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025011108
item.description:
Report X-2025011108

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that on of the five metal cans inside had spilled its contents. The can was dented on the side causing the lid to open. All of the cans had positive closure tabs and were packaged with styrofoam packing peanuts inside of a plastic bag. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
